topic.title: Creating a Member Refset concept manually

body.note: The preferred method for creating reference sets is via specification refsets as described in . For large refsets, this method usually involves fewer steps and is easier to maintain. The following describes the method for creating refset members directly manually.
body.section: Create a member refset concept first, before creating its corresponding specification refset. This is to ensure that a destination exists for the IHTSDO Workbench refset processing algorithm to populate when a specification refset is first specified.

section.title: Creating a member refset
section.p: A member refset has a name which is a concept. So the first step in creating a member refset is to create the concept which names the refset, and so will have a fully qualified name and a preferred name. The Terminology Workbench IDE already has a refset node in in the concept hierarchy under the Refset Auxilliary Concept hierarchy, to which the concept should have a source IS-A relationship. Use either the add new concept button, or the clone concept button of the component panel. Additionally, a member refset will reference its marked parent refset, which also will be automatically populated when the refset is computed from its specification.
